column4: Okay. How do I configure update-grub /not/ to put "splash" into the kernel options for the images to boot?
its in /boot/grub/menu.lst take off the splash command at the end of your kernel
I know how to do it in menu.lst, but update-grub CHANGES menu.lst, hence why I asked specifically update-grub.
oh my mistake
Yeah, got a friend who's having a problem with usplash on their server system, cause they have a POS video card. ;)
I know even the CLI installer puts the splash screen when grub is installed.
Not the server install edition.
yeah it's true.  that server install cd was worthless... try the alternate install, it has a CLI install
Heh, the server install is what my friend used, no problem, actually.
woah that server kernel is huuuuge.  everything you can think of is included in it :p
It's got SELinux stuff in it.
not sure what SElinux is.... googling
Kernel hardening stuff. ;)
ah.  I tried that server install then went to desktop minimal install and built from there.
I haven't done a server install since 6.10. :)   I've upgraded since then, on my 10 servers. ;)
woah sounds like a full time job :)
Nah., not really. My servers run my house. ;)
in what way?  in the fact that your heater is now obsolete? hehehe

I programmed jackrabbit modules to handle signal inputs from basic serial lines, to be able to turn on/off my house lights, lock/unlock my doors, turn on the A/C set to a specific temperature, Cool or Heat. it handles my TV media streaming, along with music radio streaming, throughout the house.
woah full automation!  Sweet.  So do you have the embedded RFID tube in your hand to wave at the door?
Heh, no. Though I do have a USB key. LOL
I guess you call it that literally.
But yeah. Basically I have my own custom-built version of what people call a "smarthouse."
